author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Hear now a tale, wrought from silk in the East,
Of Ant, the great merchant, from its trap released.
Treasure ensnared, by chains of bargain bound,
An opportunity gained, for lost gold to be found.

In the land where Trump's banner with pride unfurled,
Stands DeSantis, his course through the tempest whirled.
His ship upon the tempestuous sea does rest,
With both friend and foe, his endeavors are put to test.

Branded a deceiver, Balenciaga endured the frost,
A pariah in his hall, reputation nearly lost.
Cloaked in his armor, crafted from fabric's weave,
With the stars of Paris, a new saga he doth weave.

feedItems.title: China's Ant Gives Trapped Investors an Opportunity to Cash Out
DeSantis Campaign Stalls as He Tries to Court Trump's GOP Fans and Foes Alike
feedItems.description: The Florida governor’s support is flat in national and early-state polling.

feedItems.title: Balenciaga Is Back After Ad Scandal: 'Making Clothes Is My Armor'
feedItems.description: With a celebrity-studded Paris couture show, a designer charts his comeback.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In yon grocer’s aisle, price climbs as if taken wing,
Eggs and meats sit still, as the cash registers ring.
Yet down the endless rows, where goods in packages sing,
Unseen inflation's snail leaves a stringent sting.

In distant Paris, as mid-July shadows cast,
Parades of checkered past howl like lonely mast.
On Bastille's Day, goats feast on tensions vast,
Echoing discordance, in the whistling political blast.

Physicians, true as rabbits, neither old nor spry,
In numbers they find strength, from dawn to twilight sky.
From yesteryear’s wisdom or youth's teachable eye,
In constant learning, they heal as the days go by.

feedItems.title: The Supermarket Aisle Where Prices Are Still Soaring
feedItems.description: Costs for meat, eggs and produce have been tamed, but inflation is running hot in grocery stores’ inner aisles, home to packaged food and household goods.

feedItems.title: The Checkered History of France's Bastille Day Parade
feedItems.description: Next week’s July 14 celebration in Paris will once again offer a symbolic stage for the country’s deep political and social tensions.

feedItems.title: Do Younger or Older Doctors Get Better Results?
feedItems.description: A physician’s effectiveness has less to do with age than with how many patients they see and how well they keep up to date on new research.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Shein, a dragon of fast-fashion's kind,
Now claims marketplace of diverse find.
Like wine from one grape, now varied blend,
They sell all, from start to untold end.

Elon Musk, a jester in his craft,
Makes Zuckerberg seem a seafaring raft.
After years of battling tide and wind,
In this jest, Zuckerberg finds kinship in the wind.

NATO, like an alehouse, extends its reach,
To lands where eastern sun doth breach.
But some cry foul, "mission creep" they call,
Whilst China sees in this a brawl.

feedItems.title: Shein Takes on Amazon in the Business of Selling Everything
feedItems.description: Founded in China as fast-fashion retailer, the company is now positioning itself as a marketplace for practically anything.

feedItems.title: Elon Musk Is Making Mark Zuckerberg Seem Cool Again
feedItems.description: The Facebook co-founder is seizing the moment with a win after years of tumult.

feedItems.title: NATO's New Focus on China Creates Internal Tension About Mission Creep
feedItems.description: For NATO, strengthening ties with Asia-Pacific nations suggest an expanded role—one that critics call mission creep and China sees as a threat.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the dance of quills and ink's great tide,
Blazon forth words of world clasped wide,
Tales spun by Clio's hand, far and wide,
What news of yore, on Eire's countrified.

Of commerce's ebb and flow, where doth it reside,
In halls of gold, or in peasants' stride?
To all with ear for coin’s chime, pray confide,
What's news - business, finance, and wealth’s wild ride?

In measures sweet, as friends beside,
Dipped in life's brine, bliss and sorrow allied,
Pepper’s bite and salt's embrace, glorified,
In every fable our hearts abide.
